keyFacts: A court conference was scheduled for August 27, 2019, to discuss dismissing the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein following his death.
Judge Berman's order indicated that victims would be allowed to be heard during the proceeding, either directly or through counsel.
The U.S. Attorney's office offered to assist victims with travel costs to attend the conference, regardless of whether they had previously spoken to prosecutors.
The correspondence shows coordination between victim attorneys and prosecutors regarding victim participation in post-death legal proceedings.
